emails.subject: Follow-up: Outstanding Action Items from MVR - Study DNLI-001 - Site 102
emails.body:
Hi Sarah,

I hope you are having a good week.

I'm following up on the Monitoring Visit Report from our visit on October 25th. There are a couple of outstanding action items that we need to close out:

1.  Updated Delegation of Authority Log: Please provide the updated log reflecting the addition of Dr. James Peterson as a new Sub-Investigator.
2.  Training Confirmation: Please provide documentation confirming that Dr. Peterson has completed the required protocol and GCP training.

Please let me know if you have an estimated timeline for when these items can be provided.

Thanks for your continued hard work on this study.

Best regards,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics

emails.subject: Re: Follow-up: Outstanding Action Items from MVR - Study DNLI-001 - Site 102
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Thanks for the reminder. 

We have Dr. Peterson's training documentation ready, which I've attached to this email. 

I am still waiting for Dr. Vance to sign the updated Delegation of Authority Log. She has been in back-to-back patient visits today but I expect to have it signed and sent over to you by EOD tomorrow.

I will let you know if there are any further delays.

Best,

Sarah Miller
Clinical Research Coordinator
UCSF Medical Center

role_descriptions: alex.johnson@denalitx.com: Denali Therapeutics (Sponsor), Clinical Research Associate
sarah.miller@ucsfmed.org: UCSF Medical Center (Site), Clinical Research Coordinator
emily.vance@ucsfmed.org: UCSF Medical Center (Site), Principal Investigator
pm_lead@pinnaclecro.com: Pinnacle CRO (CRO), Project Management Lead
description: A routine follow-up email from Alex Johnson to a site coordinator regarding outstanding action items from the last monitoring visit report. The email specifically requests an updated Delegation of Authority Log to reflect a new sub-investigator and confirmation of completed training for the new staff member.
